channel.title: Posts on zexuannotes
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on zexuannotes

item.title: Math Question Answering
item.description: Describing my interest in MathQA, and collecting good papers and resources in a single place.

item.title: Setting up Nextcloud on Unraid
item.description: President’s day weekend project - get my photos off Google!

item.title: ETL My Credit Cards to GSheets
item.description: Data’s not very useful sitting in a database collecting static and dust. We’re gonna take that the credit card transaction data from last week and gift it to Google (sheets). For desserts we also slap Slack notifications onto the Airflow instance.

item.title: Setting Up Apache Airflow in a VM
item.description: I want all my credit card transaction data in one place. I’m going to use Airflow to schedule jobs that use the Plaid API to extract and process this data on a daily basis.

item.title: Migrating from Ghost to Hugo
item.description: Why not Git commit my blog?

item.title: My Unraid Setup
item.description: Documenting going down the rabbit hole after looking for a basic hypervisor.

item.title: Using Grafana, Prometheus, and PostgreSQL
item.description: Disclaimer: This honest review of using Grafana (and then Prometheus after I was too far in) was done for the SE4AI class by Christian Kaestner. I would link it here, but silly me cannot seem to get the hyperlink to work in the summary section.

item.title: ETL on the Cheap with AWS
item.description: Or how to be a an absolute scrooge using AWS as a student who ran out of GitHub Educate funds. Full of funny practices, such as putting long-lived functions in Lambdas, turning off the production database when not in use, and scheduling ETL on the clock without triggers.

item.title: Zipf's Law Distribution of Skills Listed in Job Postings
item.description: Look at this distribution of text, it looks suspiciously like Zipf’s law! I’m going to take that out of context and opine that it applies to this text too.

item.title: Effectively Free ETL with Lambdas
item.description: Who knew AWS Lambdas had a free tier? Life is great indeed. Here we rejoice over the magnimity of Bezos and talk about how to package our functions into Lambdas.

item.title: Latex: Five Line Gloss for Linguistics Typesetting
item.description: I’m not great with LaTex, but I need a five-line gloss for the conlang I’m building for Minecraft (for a class). Using the expex package, we can bootstrap a five-line gloss from the tools it provides out of the box.

item.title: Piazza Integration for Slack
item.description: The homeworks haven’t come in for grading yet. Students complain that we don’t respond to Piazza questions quickly enough. I suppose if the questions fly directly into our Slack, that might speed things up a tad. Piazza doesn’t officially support an API, so I built around it!

item.title: Thoughts on a Design Pattern for Facebook Chatbots
item.description: A compilation of post-mortem thoughts on building my first Facebook chat bot that is more than just a ‘Hello World’, mostly motivated that almost everyone seems to be just building a thing that works without much thought about the context.

item.title: Project Malmo: Discrete Pathing Maze Solver
item.description: I’d like a Minecraft bot that cuts trees, mines coal, harvests wheat, digs holes, etc etc. I suppose we could start by trying to make one that stays alive!
